Reviews.Title: “clean comfy and convieient”
Reviews.Author: julie a
Reviews.Content: we had a three night stay here in a twin room, the room although not huge was comfortable, and adequate for our needs. towels were replaced daily and room cleaned.we found the front desk staff very helpful and polite in the day and in fact one receptionist went out of her way to help me on a couple of occasions. The hotel itself is located very close to the metro( charrone) which we used frequently and has some nice little cafes , restaurants and supermarkets within a two minute walk. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we preferred to get something enroute . the only criticsm was the lack of tea/ coffee making facilities in the room itself which i did enquire about , they do not come with a standard room apparently but i think they should look at putting them in all rooms as they usually come as a standard ! would reccomend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome wee find in real Paris!”
Reviews.Author: kiwihol
Reviews.Content: A fantastic wee place with a lovely garden. Perfect to look out over as relaxing on bed between shopping, sightseeing and eating! Great real Parisian neighbourhood with lovely wee shops and restaurants nearby. Basic but adequate breakfast, clean tidy rooms, bath in bathroom and a really good value spot in a safe neighbourhood. I had some time on my own here and some with my cousin, and felt safe going back at night. Metro takes you anywhere and is very close. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. I spent 9 days here in Sept 2011. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful reception to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SAC49
Reviews.Content: Really friendly, courteous and helpful man on reception (should have taken his name down). The continential breakfast was inclusive in my £71 / 84 euros price for a one night stay. My room was clean, tidy and quiet - just what I wanted. My trip was to attend a funeral at Pere Lachaise Cemetery and I would recommend anyone who is walking to attend a service there note that the Le crematorium building is closer to Metro Gambetta than Charonne station. If you start your walk at the Charonne end then its cobble stones, so you might like to consider your footwear. I had dinner at Noy Noy, a Thai restaurant just around the corner from the hotel. The meal was exceptional, but I would recommend if you are a party of more than 1, to book as it was packed. Anyway, totally recommend this hotel and wish you a wonderful stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in Summer!”
Reviews.Author: Norfolkdumpling1971
Reviews.Content: This is a bijou little hotel with lovely staff & a 1 minute walk away from the nearest Metro. We had a really brilliant time here but I have rated it as average as I believe that is what it is. The two biggest "issues" I had with the place, 1) No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. If you think that a coffee is between 3 - 5 Euros a pop this would have been a god send each morning. You can get as many coffees as you like for breakfast for 10 Euros but it's not the same as being able to have one any time without feeling ripped off! The breakfast is ok, you can eat as much as you like but it is nothing special, however when you factor in the cost of drinks in Paris it is much more cost effective to have it in the hotel than out. Even if you got a coffee & a pastry at a bar you won't get such good value. The other isssue I had was the fact there was no air con. For us this was fine as it was March but one night it was quite hot & you just can't open the patio doors or windows as the traffic noise is immense. However, on the street you are opposite a lovely little Italian Deli, there is a fromagerie, two brilliant patiesseries. (The one up the street is the best for bread but the one nearest the Boulevard Voltaire made the most amazing pastries I've ever had in my life) There is a Halal butcher that cooks rotisserie chickens which were also superb. You can get most anything you need food/drink/pharmacy wise in the Rue De Charonne! The room was small, the bed comfy & the bathroom beyond tiny, but the staff were lovely, very friendly & helpful & being so close to the Metro was great after a long day out pounding the streets. Can't say I'll be back for sure but if we want something cheap in the Winter we'd probably go back. It would depend on the cost & what other deals we could get.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with confidence”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: Even though I had booked a twin room, the lovely lady at reception was happy to upgrade us to a double at no extra cost. All the staff were most friendly and they were happy to go the extra mile to make your stay all the more enjoyable. It's a little bit out the way of the main attractions, but so close to the Metro that it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Budget vacation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zerosxt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend some day in Paris and we try to get the best deal for the money. I booked this hotel using the Eurostar booking system 2 months before the trip. The hotel itself is very good, it seemed to me that i was recently refurbished because most of the stuff look pretty new, My wife was very happy with the mattress and even more the bathroom. The bathroom clean and plenty of space. We had a Flat screen TV. The rooms is very comfortable and we had breakfast which was an added value to our trip. The hotel was more to sleep and rest after long day during tourism in Paris. The hotel is very close to the Charonne Metro station and it will only take 20 minutes to the main Paris attraction. Some people would say it is a bit far, but we walked to the Bastille roundabout and to Le Marais district in a few minutes. The area is plenty of food shops around so if you fell hungry you can buy fruits. Also there are lot, lots of drugs stores which was very handy for us. The receptionists spoke perfect English and it is open 24/7. they gave us a very useful map of Paris and they were very kind explaining us how to move around. so in conclusion you can not go wrong with this hotel, is good values for the money. Armando and Tania from Panama ( I live in UK)

Reviews.Title: “Great 'budget' hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights last week in a double room on the 3rd floor, overlooking the small terrace at the rear of the hotel. It was easy to find from the nearest tube station (Charonne), which is literally 2 minutes away. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the room, whilst not the most modern in style, was more than adequate. We thought the half size wardrobe was a bit on the small side between the two of us, but as we only stayed a few days it wasn't a problem. The bed was comfortable and we heard no noise from other guests or from outside until a reasonable hour. Breakfast was quite basic: croissants, bread, cooked meats, cheeses, cereal, yoghurt and fresh fruit salad. However, plenty to fill you up until lunch. The area close to the hotel and the Rue de Charonne itself (towards the Bastille) is a lively area with lots of bars/restaurants, bakeries etc. Importantly for us, it also felt very safe and we were happy to stroll back to the hotel after a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Classics Hotel Bastille”
Reviews.Author: Omer T
Reviews.Content: The Classics Hotel Bastille is not particularly fancy or luxurious. It is, however, clean and well maintained, and has some of the friendliest and most welcoming staff I've ever met at any hotel. And it seems like it's not one particular person or another; it's each and every person that I met at the reception over the course of my week long stay. We got some very nice restaurant recommendations from them, as well as some free snacks at the middle of the night when we came in after all the restaurants were already closed. Taking into account the fair pricing, this hotel has a very high value to cost. The location is excellent, with a neighborhood full of restaurants and bistros, but far enough from the tourist attractions to be populated mostly by locals. There is a metro station right outside the door, so the center of town is a few minutes away by train.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JayProbe
Reviews.Content: Great location and less than 30 seconds walk from Charonne Metro Stop! The room was very clean & quiet but upgrade to the superior rooms if you like you tea and coffee making facilities! The staff were always very helpful and were kind enough to lend us a phone charger and to leave our bags in the office whilst we went travelling on our last day! You get a decent breakfast served at reasonable hours but pick your times right as it does get busy! In all we had Very good value for money during our 2 night stay and would stay again for sure! James and Charlotte Probert

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Staffs-couple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during November. Room was basic but clean and fine for just a few nights. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were exceptional! Also the room had a flat screen television and the bathroom was bigger than expected. The breakfast was buffet style, and whilst not having a lot of choice it was adequate to keep you going until lunchtime. All in all we thought it was good value for money and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Pat1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 6 nights in November during a business conference. It had excellent WiFi which was essential. It was very reasonable!! especially after I had found a very good rate on otelcom. The location was perfect since it was very close to the conference. Staff was friendly and helpful, most especially Alvaro who worked in the evenings. Lots of restaurants and cafes in the area. Very close to the metro. My room, a single, was small but adequate. On the 6th floor, it faced the courtyard in back, had a charming view of Paris rooftops, and a lovely terrace which more than made up for the small room size. Breakfast could be had either in the lovely breakfast room or served in the room. The hotel was very clean. Water pressure and temperature control in the shower was fine. There is an Office Depot nearby which came in handy. It was a great value and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: dennis g
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 days (26.10.2011 till 1.11.2011)...Nice small hotel, very close to the metro station Charonne (1 min walk) and to Bastille pubs, clubs and restaurants (5-7 min walk)... The room was very cozy and clean, small balcony, a bath and a big screen LCD TV with European channels. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast was nice. The area is very nice and quiet and the M9 metro line takes you to almost all main sites and attractions... We will definitely consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: debsta53
Reviews.Content: We began our 2 week trip to Paris and Provence in Paris and stayed the first 3 nights in Classics Hotel Bastille and were happy with our choice. First of all, the reviews on Trip Advisor were favorable and we were able to use frequent flyer miles to pay for it so we booked it. Very glad that we did. The location isn't the most glamorous in Paris but it is in a working class neighborhood with easy access to the Metro. Lots of small cafes, restaurants, patisseries and other small specialty shops within a short walk. Relatively quiet for Paris especially at night which was a plus. Our room was just the right size for 2 people and was comfortable, clean with all amenities that we needed. Closet space was good however my only complaint was that there was no drawer space. Not a big deal. The best part of our stay at Classics Hotel Bastille was the night manager, Alvaro. He was beyond exceptional. Friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and accommodating underestimate him. He made our stay in Paris memorable and thanks to his advice we were able to maximize our time and see a lot of the city which we otherwise may have missed. We so enjoyed our conversations with him. I would definitely recommend Classics Hotel Bastille! Kudos to Alvaro who appears to really enjoy his job!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clcuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in August, the hotel was easy enough to find, is a stone's throw from the metro stop. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff, particularly Ryad, were helpful and friendly. We had a room overlooking the garden, which was peaceful and quiet. The hotel isn't in the centre of Paris, but it's only a short metro ride to all the tourist areas. The only mild downside was that the shower wasn't especially easy to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad option”
Reviews.Author: amm1u
Reviews.Content: Most of the comments about this hotel are fairly accurate. It is conveniently located, reasonably priced and offers a reasonable standard of accommodation, although it’s probably over-rated at 3 stars. On the plus side, the rooms are clean, nicely looked after and the staff are incredibly helpful. It is right next to a Metro station and although it’s a fair distance from the main tourist attractions, the local area is lively and there are plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars nearby. Despite that, the room I had at the back was one of the quietest I have ever had in Paris. One of the main reasons I chose it was for the free WiFi, but this only worked sporadically while I was there, despite the staff knowing of the problem for several days. There are a few other important negatives which anyone considering booking should be aware of. First, the rooms are very small, do not have air conditioning (although there was a fan available), fridge or coffee/tea facilities and soundproofing is poor. The breakfast can only be described as adequate, with a poor choice and most things being of low quality or in plastic packages. So all in all, not a bad budget option, but don’t expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Durrance_Bagale
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel, for 3 nights this time. Our previous stay was in a superior room, and although we did notice the difference between that room and the standard room we were in this time (basically a bit smaller and no tea-making facilities), it wasn't a problem. The staff were helpful and friendly, the breakfast was good, fresh and plentiful, the room was very clean and tidy. I had asked for a room at the front of the hotel, and we didn't really notice the noise from the street much. The hotel is very close to the metro, although we tend to walk pretty much everywhere in Paris, which is doable if you're moderately fit and like walking! The Algerian restaurant next door continues to serve wonderful couscous poulet and decent, cheap red wine. The only slight issue I had was when the receptionist tried to charge me for the room when we checked out. I had already paid for the Eurostar and hotel package, but he wouldn't believe me, saying '99% of the time guests pay on checkout'. Even when I showed him the pre-paid hotel receipt he just shrugged and said that their computer must be wrong. An apology or at least some acknowledgement of the fact that I wasn't lying would have been appreciated. Apart from that it was a great stay, and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: spiderfernandez
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with a friend whose comment was on booking, "It's cheap. Hopefully cheap and cheerful." I am happy to say that it is exactly that. "Boutique" is a fair description. The room was smallish but well furnished and very clean. The reception area is appealing and is not just a facade for the rest of the hotel. Breakfast is provided and is very good with a decent selection. Every staff member was extremely courteous and helpful. We couldn't have asked for much more on this front. The location is OK. It's not the most exciting precinct but is very close to the Metro station and just a few stops form the central tourist area. There are plenty of cafes and bars close by and a couple of convenience stores too. In a city that can be quite expensive it's a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: lindafrompotch
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in June 2011 for a week. This Paris trip started badly as i was robbed by a pickpocket at the Gare du Nord, however i have to thank the lovely lady who works at the font desk who assisted us so kindly on arrival with information about the nearest police station and who was always there to give any information with a smile. This kind of service really makes all the difference. Our room was comfortable with everything you need, the only thing we really missed was a kettle for making hot drinks when coming back from excursions. The breakfast was good, the breadrolls was excellent but the poor croissants and pain chocolates were unfortunately not good at all! All the other items at breakfast were great. The location of the hotel is good, in the vibrant Bastille area with the metro a minutes walk away. Hopefully we will be back in future.

Reviews.Title: “A rare precious find!”
Reviews.Author: Linnie143
Reviews.Content: Location (about 33 steps from Metro station), cleanliness, convenience (lift to all floors), very affordable, substantial breakfast, helpful staff who graciously spoke English, comfortable (even for a 4-night stay), mostly quiet PLUS a view of the garden courtyard and Paris rooftops! Definitely worth a return visit. A small (the shower is tricky for a broad-shouldered man) but beautiful, precious gem. On the must-do list for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great value accommodation. Nothing bad to say!”
Reviews.Author: Samserena
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. So warm, friendly and helpful! Good rooms, great breakfast, quick walk to the metro. Really good value! Some friends of ours were staying at a hostel down the road with no brekky for the same price! Definate recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Style Hotel with Super Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MSSarah2010
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel! The rooms are quite small, but very comfortable. We were a family of three with two rooms as we booked late and could not get a triple. One of our rooms opened up onto a charming little balcony/deck and the other room had nice airy windows. So, even though the rooms were small we didn't feel cramped.. The front desk staff was outstanding! They were super friendly and really made us feel welcomed! Kudos in particular to Ryad. We loved the location, although it was not particularly close to the tourist attractions. It had a real neighborhood feel. People were lined up every morning at the little bakery a few doors down and we enjoyed drinks and friendly conversation at the restaurant/ bar located next door.

Reviews.Title: “I´d sure stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Klettenberg
Reviews.Content: It´s a small and cozy hotel very well located and with a helpfull staff. I´ve stayed in Classics Hotel Bastille with my husband for 4 nights and we enjoyed it. The room was small but very clean and so was the bathroom. The breakfast didn´t have a great variety of food but everything was in a high quality and tasty. The staff was great!!! They really made us feel at home. The hotel was also beside a grocery store, restaurants and the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Utah_Doanes
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the good reviews it has gotten here on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. The room was clean and while small it was fine for our needs. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. And it is within very close walking distance of the metro and various shops and restaurants. I forgot to bring shampoo with me and there is a little grocery store a few shops down that had everything I needed. There is also a very good pizza place directly across the street from the hotel that is a good price. If we ever go back to Paris, would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: marvin_schembri
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel during the last week of June 2011. The receptionists were all very helpful. Alvaro, the Portuguese receptionist, was extremely friendly and very enthusiastic to assist us in getting around Paris. We were a bit lost but thanks to him we got around Paris easily. We felt at home during our stay in this hotel and would strongly recommend it. Moreover, the hotel is very close to the Charonne Metro station, line 9. The hotel is very close to restaurants and cafeterias. The hotel was very clean and relaxing. A negative comment is that the hotel room was small but this is very typical of Parisian hotels. Another negative comment was the breakfast which lacked variety. Nevertheless, our impression of this hotel was very good especially through the friendly service we received. Marvin Schembri from Malta

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: abeach11
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! I completely recommend it! I stayed there while I was going to school at Cambridge over the Summer and a group of girls decided to go to Paris for the weekend! The hotel was easy to find, because it is so close to the metro... like 1 block away! And I felt safe the whole time! Yes stay here! I promise it is safe!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellingschel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the metro (Charonne Line 9) and bus stop. Close by is a supermarket, fruit shop, bakeries, pizzeria, restaurants and cafes. The restaurant next door serves good meals. The breakfast included has good variety and will set you up for the day. Lovely little garden you can sit in at the end of the day, The hotel staff are all very friendly, helpful and speak good English. I stayed in a standard room, and although small, it still had a desk and wardrobe, single bed - all fine for me. As a single female traveller I felt very safe in the Charonne area walking around, and in fact I enjoyed coming back to the more normal suburban atmosphere after being in the tourist crowds elsewhere in Paris. I stayed 6 nights in this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: dienuta05
Reviews.Content: Regarding cleanliness especially, which is indeed a problem in Paris. Very useful and friendly staff, good breakfast, good location. maybe a bigger closet is needed. A big + for the (free) safe in the room. We'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paris_FranceLiz
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but clean and quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel was very close to metro station but we walked: about half an hour's walk to the centre of Paris. Lively area with lots of restaurants. Seemed popular with young crowds. Breakfast was included in the price and perfectly OK. Not so good: not much space to store clothes eg no drawers in room; dining room is small and on one morning we had to wait for a table although staff did their best to clear tables quickly;

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuitai
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is ok. The room is clean but small and doesn't have a safe to put valuable things away. For what I paid, the hotel is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: BigCane00
Reviews.Content: I was going to Paris by mysef and did not want to spend a lot of money so I stated at the Classics Hotel Bastile. I liked it. I consider it to be a very good 3 star hotel that is really a 3+. Now If you want a 4 or 5 star hotel. You should stay somewhere else and, of course, pay more.I found the staff to be very helpful and thier English to be very good. The front desk wss very helpful With Tourist avice and gave me a map with sites and subway and gave me suggestions. Sure the rooms are small but this is Europe. The neighborhood was safe but the area is noisy but there also is a market on the block and nearby restaurants. For those planning on going during the summer you should note that there is no AC (or at least I did not see one or figure it out if there was one - call if this is important to you) so if you go during the summer you should keep that in mind. The wi-fi Internet was helpful but needs to be reset every hour and goes out periodically but good enough for me. The breakfast was fine and consisted of croissants and slices of ham /salami and cereal and coffee and juice.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN HOTEL, SAFE NEIGHBOURHOOD”
Reviews.Author: GEORGIATRI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean with great staff in the reception desk. The rooms are a little bit confined but qiet and well equipped, with a plasma TV, a safe box, but without a refrigarator. Only breakfast is of average quality. The hotel is well located in a safe neighbourhood, with plenty of cafes and restaurants, a SUPER MARKET almost nexto door and a metro station nearby. Given the fact that hotel rooms in PARIS are expencive this hotel is A GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY CHOICE FOR LOW BUDGET TRAVELERS. I WOULD CHOOSE THIS HOTEL IN FUTURE TRIPS TO PARIS.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay but lost reservation”
Reviews.Author: bizbear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Air France Vacations based upon the Trip Advisor reviews. On our arrival at the hotel Saturday AM after a 9 hour flight, the woman at the desk told us they could not find our reservation. We had the voucher from the travel agency but no reservation was found. The hotel was full, we were told. The woman at the desk tried to call the local branch of the travel agency but it was closed on the weekend. She called around and found a room for us at a nearby hotel, the Grand Hotel Dore. The woman took our voucher & copied it, said they would follow up since it appeared to have been booked and we had paid for it. She said they would pay the Hotel Dore for our stay since they would be paid by the agency. I have posted a review for the Hotel Dore separately. Once we got checked into the other hotel, I was able to use my cell phone to call the travel agency back in the states once they opened. They spoked to the Classics Hotel and confirmed with them our move. Our agency was quick to ask if we were satisfied with the new hotel (as it was not one of their hotels). We were very satisfied but our agency said if we wanted, to let them know if we wished to be moved & they would find us another hotel. (As a side note the day after we moved to the new hotel, the Classic called us and said they had a cancellation and could take us back. We thanked them for their offer but since we had already unpacked and gotten settled in, we said we would stay where we were.) We had stayed in the area of the Classics hotel before & had been looking forward to returning to Blvd Voltaire but found the new neighborhood very nice. We had left a cane at the hotel while trying to check in, they kept it for us until we could return back to them to get it a few days later. We thought we had lost it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: bellsy1
Reviews.Content: It was a little difficult to find a reasonably priced and located hotel in Paris, however Classics Hotel Bastille turned out to be good value and in a convenient location. Whilst no major 'icons' or 'landmarks' are nearby to the hotel (you'll pay through the nose to be anywhere near something famous), it is only a 3 minute walk from the Charonne metro station on the 9 line, which we found to be extremely convenient to pretty much anywhere we wanted to go to. Unless you're rich and take taxis everywhere no matter where you stay in Paris you'll be using the metro constantly, so it doesn't really matter if you are a little bit out of the 'heart' of the tourist attractions. Nearby are plenty of cafes, supermarkets and convenience stores so you'll always have things handy within a few minutes walk. The room was a reasonable size without being particularly big, and also had a balcony facing the street. It was however a bit noisy outside, and it didn't have air conditioning so we always slept with the fan on even though it we only had (disappointingly) mild weather despite being summer. If you stay there during a really hot summer I think the room would become quite uncomfortably warm, with no choice but to open the balcony doors for cool air and the accompanying noise. There was no fridge in the room, however there was a safe. Internet was provided free of charge which is always handy, and so was a decent continental breakfast which included corn flakes, yoghurt, juice, fruit and pastries. All reception staff were very friendly and always willing to answer questions. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris, and for the price this was a very good value hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “clean tidy hotel very close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: 4rachael
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights in September on a Eurostar city break deal for 130 p/p. Excellent value for money at this price. This included breakfast which was simple but sufficient consisting of bread, croissants, pan au chocolate, salami, yogurt, cheese, ham and juice/coffee/tea. Breakfast runs from 7-10am. One morning I got down at 9.30 with not so much on offer, the next morning at 7am with the full selection with fresh warm pastries mmmm. Rooms are clean n tidy with desk, chair, tv and internet access for free. Bathrooms have a soap dispenser with a mixture that supplies both shampoo and bodywash so ladies I suggest you bring your own supplies. Bathroom has a decent wall hairdryer. Hotel is pretty central if using the metro for travel, its only a couple of mins from the metro station. It takes about 40 mins from Eurostar to the hotel by metro using two lines. Note : There is no minibar or fridge in the room. However staff were happy to supply corkscrew, glasses, plate and knife so we could eat/drink in he room. There is a really nice restaurant on the same street (number 13) called Chez Paul it gets pretty busy with the locals so you may want to book. I recommend the fillet steak in pepper sauce and the burbon creme brule.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalucy73
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful hotel staff, easy acess to transportation, clean room, nice area, good breakfast in a nice room overlooking garden.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kdesmo
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old daughter and I planned a last minute trip to Paris for 5 days. This hotel was adequate for our needs and a decent price of 150 euros per night that I booked from www.booking.com. We felt safe in the area, even returning as late as 11:30 pm on the metro. This is more the "People's Paris" rather than touristy, so you have to take the metro (the station is very close) to get to any attractions. The room was basic but clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful and all of them spoke very good English The breakfast was included in the price and it consisted of juices, coffee, cereal, croissants, cheeses and sliced meats served on a pleasant but crowded terrace. The taxi ride back to the airport was arranged by the hotel and cost 53 euros. We did not hear any street noise from outside the hotel but we heard noises all night long from INSIDE the hotel including people talking, water running, elevator noise, and doors opening and closing. Aside from the internal noise which made it difficult to get a good nights sleep, the stay good. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and do not mind being a little farther from the center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a quiete area”
Reviews.Author: Mezajee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiete and typical 3 stars hotel. The rooms are small with balcony. The staff is friendly, but the room service is not that much. The Charonne station just at the corner and directly takes you to Chams Elysses and Arc de Triophe. If you care only about the place comfort and cleanliness, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Durrance_Bagale
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was big by Paris standards (shower AND bathtub!) and clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included in the price; standard French fare, fresh and plentiful. The hotel was about a minute's walk from the Charonne metro station and was an easy journey from the Eurostar terminal at the gare du Nord. I also have to recommend the Algerian restaurant next to the hotel (on the left as you face the hotel). I was not a fan of couscous (only 10 euros for the delicious couscous poulet!) before I went but I've been converted, and you can't beat 9 euros for a litre of French red either. The staff were lovely and even brought us second helpings (and then third helpings of wine..). I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, compact but bijoux”
Reviews.Author: FeelGoodFactor
Reviews.Content: i was a bit worried initially when my partner booked this hotel in the Bastille area through Expedia, flights and accomodation for what seemed a too good to be true rate. But I wasnt disappointed. It was very clean, rooms werent that big but adequate....the shower in our room was very small but all in all I couldnt fault the place. Breakfast was a help yourself affair to cereal and croissants etc., but all laid out in a very pleasant conservatory at the back. The area itself felt like a neighbourhood, a place where people lived and worked rather than a tourist heartland....a 15minute walk from the Bastille itself but a pleasant and very safe walk to all the local bars and restaraunts that are plenty. An open bus tour for 2 day pass is handy to get your bearings and thereafter we bought a 10 ticket Metro pass which was more than enought for the 4 days we were there walking around and catching the sites. You may need more if the weather is poor but luckily on this occasion the weather was superb! Loved the trip, hotel and the city - and without a doubt its the most beautiful out of all the european cities i have visited. Happy Holidays!

Reviews.Title: “basic, but a good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissNJCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room with my mother for four nights this April. The room was a bit small but had enough room to walk around beds and keep suitcases open on the floor. The bathroom was clean and kept nice everyday with clean towels. The staff were very friendly, and spoke good English. They were helpful with all sorts of questions we had about where things were. The breakfast was continental style with croissants, pain au chocolat, cereal, yoghurts etc. The one negative was a mouldy ceiling but as we were not in the room much it didn't really bother me.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel which is worthy of booking for holidays”
Reviews.Author: Emmi_23
Reviews.Content: Hi, i 've stayed at the hotel with my boyfriend for 6 nights and its was fantastic for my first holidays in Paris. We were very satisfied of the room that we've booked on the net by reading the reviews and i will add to that these people reviews were right. The staff were very nice people. The room was clean though it was a little bit small but it was perfect for me and my boyfriend. The metro is about one minute walking distance and lots of restaurants in the surrounding. Very close to many attractions. The breakfast wasnt that big breakfast but for the price we've paid for the nights it was excellent. You can get help anytime you want or if you need something they have a 24 hours staff and there was a lift and free wi-fi which was very good too. Hope this will help you in booking your holidays at the hotel, Cheers, xxx

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HikerNorthofLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night here on our way to a ski-ing holiday. It was very close to the Metro and there were plenty of restaurants close by. The room which overlooked the garden was quiet and the ensuite excellent. The inclusive breakfast was another plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyth0n2Bristol
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris in February and booked the Classics on the web for 3 nights. The hotel was very easy to find, the staff were helpful, spoke good English and there was a simple charm about the whole experience. Our room was cosy and spotlessly clean every day. We arrived in Paris on the Eurostar and it took only 15 minutes on the Metro changing once to get to Charonne station. Don't bother with a taxi if you don't have much to carry. Brekfast was not in our rate but they offered it on a complimentary basis so we had no complaints. Typical continental breakfast with a decent cup of coffee and plenty of everything. We tried a few places for dinner, the best and definitely recommended is La Fee Verte just a few minutes from the Voltaire Metro Station - full of French diners, always a good sign - wonderful. If your planning to do the sites, don't bother with the open top busses. Eurostar sold us 2 tickets in London. The bus drivers are miserable, the services are infrequent and if your not at the stop, they don't wait. We would have spent the entire weekend wasting time at bus stops, a waste of £64. The Metro is brilliant, very quick and cheap putting London Underground to shame. If you do need the internet, the wifi service does not work.

Reviews.Title: “Character & Charm”
Reviews.Author: Earby
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt a superlative Parisian Hotel, in a decent part of town, and near most attractions. The staff are really good and very helpful, the rooms are a bit on the small side but who cares, one does not visit Paris to sit in a hotel room! Breakfast is basic, but abundant and tasty. There is a restaurant/bar next door which serves the most delightful food at the most insanely cheap prices, highly recomended! The only complaint is that the advertised free WiFi, may well be free, but it does absolutley nothing at all, useless.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: MelSlo
Reviews.Content: quite OK for such price, clean and quiet, but not in walking distance to the center. close to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid Range Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StubeyDoo
Reviews.Content: A great mid range hotel if you cant afford the expensive luxorious ones. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. They even gave us breakfast in bed even though it wasnt specified in the hotel services. Some of the Bistros were excellent in the charonne area but get there early if you dont book as they are extremley popular with locals. Finally if you were going to center of paris ie north/south its really convenient however going east/west is more awkward. Would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small and familiar hotel, well located near subway station”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Herrera
Reviews.Content: good breakfast nice personnel pleasant bedrooms well located with pay parking

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AtLast_Europe
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful to stay here on our first trip to Paris, as the staff of the hotel were extraordinarily helpful, providing directions and a tremendous suggestion for a local restaurant at night. The rooms were comfortable, and the balcony a special delight.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: From_the_Port
Reviews.Content: Despite getting there at 10am ( hoping to simply leave our luggage until checkin time), we were kindly offered a free upgrade to a superior room which was available immediately. The room was spacious by Paris standard, and comfortable witn a nice big HD TV. The bathroom was very clean. A small safe was available ( not big enough for a laptop) . The price included the breakfast (7-10am) which was a buffet- nice croissants and fruit bowls. We were impressed by the service when we arrived but also by the restaurant recommandations given. Some nice French cuisine restaurants nearby, as well as Chinese places. The subway Charonnes is 2 mn away, easy to reach the main RER from there. It's a quiet spot and the area felt safe even in the evening. Full price over our budget but we found it with a special offer. Overall, excellent place to stay for 1 night or more!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: gallinacido
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and near to the underground (less than 100 meters). So it is possible to reach all the monuments very fast. The only negative point is the breakfast that is not so rich.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for clean friendly hotel with fine breakfast”
Reviews.Author: childeh
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel with my wife in October 2009 and were impressed with the clean rooms and up to date modern decor (good LCD TV) All receptionists were exceedingly friendly (English spoken)and helpful and the breakfast was usual continental but more than adequate. A stones throw from the Charonne underground station and well placed for connections. Ask for room at the back over the little courtyard garden for a quiet night. Would have no problem in recommemding this little gem of a hotel. Would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: CameliaBucharest
Reviews.Content: it is a very comfortable hotel, small rooms but clean, a very good and clean bathroom, with all the amenities, a big LCD in the room. A little bit noisy, the walls are thin. It is situated in a very nice area, with supermarkets, foire aux vins, cafes, restaurants, different shops in immediate vicinity. Breakfast pretty good, with different kind of cheese, very good coffee, yoghurts, croissants, butter and so on. The staff very polite. Overall I think I would stay another time in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - Très bon hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter19801980
Reviews.Content: Very good position, underground nearby. Receptionists very kind. Breakfast included (rare in Paris). Price is very good, considering the quality of the hotel. Free wi-fi Internet!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel with gentle staff”
Reviews.Author: Jungespaar
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean, bigger than normal parisian hotel rooms (it was a superior room). ask for a room on the garten side, it is incredibly quiet! Breakfast takes place in the inner garten and it's really a nice start in the day. Staff is very helpfull and polite, wi-fi is free. The location is central, subway-station is only 1 minute away from the hotel and from there you can go everywhere in Paris. The Bastille Place is reachable by feet and this is a pittoresque way to there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value hotel for a Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: moffmeister
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel originally from TA reviews and it's location (and the fact it has parking on site). Yes rooms are small but I wouldn't say restrictively so. Free wireless internet for the kids and their I-wotsits. Rooms and all facilities are very clean. Staff pleasant and helpful. Breakfast adequate for the price being paid for the room - certainly didn't think the stuff was stale like some other comments. Rooms at the front are noisy, yes, but at home we live in the middle of nowhere and my wife and I managed okay, in fact I liked the contrast. If you are a light sleeper specifically request a room at the rear. Also the parking is limited - make sure you book! In summary perfect for the price, great location and just around the corner from a fanastic bar/restuarant Bistro Melac (www.melac.fr) where the atmosphere, and food is fantastic (especially the cheese!). Will be staying there again (just to go to Melac)

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for reptiles, not people”
Reviews.Author: Lemain
Reviews.Content: In most respects the hotel was adequate but the inside temperature of the room (and the adjacent area of our hotel) was around 28C with an outside air temperature of less than 20C. There is no air conditioning. The windows open but it is a VERY noisy area and few people would be able to sleep in that noise. Few would be able to sleep in the heat, with the windows shut, either. It is probably OK in the cooler months but it isn't inexpensive so would not be my first choice at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and valuable”
Reviews.Author: pietrospada
Reviews.Content: The staff was gentle and kind. The location is superb: 1 min. walking from the metro, lots of nice shops around. breakfast not as good but superb "patisserie" in the neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but would like a room off the street to avoid late-evening noise.”
Reviews.Author: sbpath
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, well-situated hotel convenient to the metro (Charone stop) and the Bastille district. I have stayed here several times and find that it is consistently reliable. My only complaint is that our room (we always get the same one), is above a noisy street. We have to remember to request a room off the street next time.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTales
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the train station and taxied to the hotel. Our first reaction to the hotel was not positive it looked almost seedy--our group was a Mom traveling with two teen-age girls. We checked in--our room had no airconditioning, and one of the three twin beds was extremely uncomfortable. We had the window open, but overlooked the Rue Charonne, and it was very noisy. The pluses were the Metro was right down the street. There were several nice restaurants and markets nearby. The breakfast room was charming, and the staff was very attentive. We had two bathrooms and free high speed internet. The cons were we traveled to Paris during the Air Show, and the price of the room was too expensive for the value. In addition, the elevator was broken during part of our stay. Not sure how we would have gotten our bags up or down without the elevator. We stored our bags, and they asked us to store them in the staircase. This is not what we are used to at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value in a Convenient NE Location”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravelGurl
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Very good rate, including 'adequate' continental breakfast, for Paris (paid 125 Euro per night). 2) Good location in the 11th - One block from the Charonne Metro stop, and 5 blocks NE of Place Bastille. 3) Quite, working-class neighborhood, all the shops and restaurants are used daily by Parisians, not tourists - you see the 'real deal' for Paris living. 4) Comfortable - beds were firm, but comfy / adequate amount of room for bags and using the desk / bathroom was modern and plenty of space, hairdryer on wall. 5) Staff speak excellent English and were especially helpful and attentive. 6) Wireless internet in the room. Cons: 1) Breakfast was just so-so with no nutritious cereals, a small amount of fatty meat, no eggs, some so-so packaged cheeses, canned fruit cocktail, and not-so-fresh pasteries. The serving area was tiny, crowded, and not well arranged, so guests took a long time to get their coffee and food. However, the area with the tables, while tight, was very bright and attractive, looking out onto a walled garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kulandi
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel - not pretty to look at, but clean and friendly with good facilities. Nice breakfast room by small garden; newspapers provided. Room 604 was great - smallish, but with a large roof terrace. Rooms have kettles, tea and coffee; free safe; free wi-fi, TV. Clean and comfortable. Room 302 is a large triple, with two bathrooms. Close to Charonne Metro (not great links with the centre, but not bad). Useful cafes and shops nearby. Walking distance to Pere Lachaise.

Reviews.Title: “If you need some kind words in a foreign country, you can get it by staff of Classics Hotel Bastille”
Reviews.Author: vikistar
Reviews.Content: Our rooms was always clean, the service was good. The bed was comfortable, and I enjoyed the sleeping in hotel. I liked the breakfast room, this was nice and small.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GermanyGiraffe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good place for a trip to Paris. The rooms are not very big, but clean and quiet (superior rooms), the breakfast is o.k., the staff friendly and the next metro station is only a few meters away. And you find several good and affordable restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxed experience”
Reviews.Author: LisaLima
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in this hotel because it was quiet, clean and all procedures were easy to follow. Furthermore, everything was ready on time and the personnel was friendly, always ready to answer our questions. The ubication of the hotel was also important. It is near a Metro station. Other guests were also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - metro close to the hotel, excellent staff, clean rooms, quiet atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: professeurBucharest
Reviews.Content: Good location - underground (metro) close to hotel, quiet, comfortable, excellent staff, very suitable for serious people

Reviews.Title: “You car can stay with you!”
Reviews.Author: PieterS37
Reviews.Content: Our room at the back, looking out on a well maintained city garden, was very quiet. The neighborhood is lively with many small independent stores, cafes and restaurants, and off the beaten tourist track. The hotel has the great asset of an underground garage, which is ideal, if one wishes to continue one's holiday outside Paris. The breakfast is nothing to write home about: mediocre bakery and coffee. Pieter S

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with some big advantages”
Reviews.Author: PeterOO7
Reviews.Content: First the location and way there: I forgot my GPS system and bought a map on the way to Paris. I found it very easy. The location is also very good as it is close to the Metro Station. The breakfast in the hotel was very good. Not very much choise, but the things that were there were really very good. I just missed a boiled egg or another egg-related possibility. Other very nice thing was the possiblitiy to leave the car in the hotel the last day, without charging extra money, that was very kind of the hotel. The room was large enough, as you normally only need it to sleep. The bathroom was also big enough. However, the room was very dusty (TV, top of cupboard) and the beds were really awful. First the mattress for a dubbel bed is 2 separate mattresses and is not so convenient. Second the quality of the mattress was so bad, I got up every morning with pain in the back. Other remark: both me and my girl wanted to recharge our sell-phone, but there was no more space for the camera. Also there was not one plug in the bathroom: how do people shave there? Other point is the very high price for internet. In the end we didn't take it because of the price. Other than point here declared, the hotel was good and I would recommend it to a friend if the beds changed.

Reviews.Title: “When in Paris again, it will be this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vaclav41
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris for sightseeing, but also going aroun Paris (Loire, Normandy ...) This hotel has garage, so I could come by car. Hotel is clean, service very good. Breakfast included, Metro very near, shops near, free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel to stay en superb room”
Reviews.Author: Yamahabiker
Reviews.Content: We were suprised of the qualilty of the hotel and the service, and because we were on motorbikes we appreciated the undergroug garage very much. Also the room was very good as well as the isolation of the streetnoise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: UrbanSuper
Reviews.Content: Chose Classics Hotel Bastille based on reviews and price. Booked this through Hotels.com and paid NOK 4.324 for 5 nights during Easter week. A good rating made my biggest concern about this hotel the location. For me it was nothing to be worried about, it's close to the metro and thus all sights. Also plenty of eating & drinking places and shops in the neighbourhood. Good continental breakfast, both ham and cheese included, free wi-fi connection and service minded staff made this a nice stay. A special commendation to the guy who welcomed us, he provided a pleasant start to our vacation. Our room was situated towards the back garden so no exposure to any street traffic. It's a peaceful hotel, but have in mind that the walls are quite thin (didn't bother us though).

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a long weekend, look forward to staying again...”
Reviews.Author: jersey10077
Reviews.Content: great location right near metro stop charonne, nice room, bathroom, good breakfast in nice b/fast room, helpful reception, quite quiet even though room was on street side,Rue Charonne a bit down trodden but felt safe day and night, gets nicer towards the river end, wonderful restaurant Chez Paul down the road in walking distance & some great bars just down the side street from there. Booked the shopping package, fantastic value at 70 euros a night for the room, although this deal was a lot less than the tariff. Wouldnt hesitate to recommend and hope to stay again. Bastille area good for tourists, strolling & dining (not really for shopping). Dont look any further unless you want total luxury, have loads of cash to spend & want to be in a fancy area.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: noa_f
Reviews.Content: very close to a metro station and easy to find. wonderful buffet breakfast included in a reasonable price. rooms are small and clean, includes a coffee corner. all the staff speak good english and answered patiently to all our questions. only one problem during our visit - they had a problem with their internet connection (for five days!!!) and sent us to pay for internet service at a place next door....

Reviews.Title: “cold Paris but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: hoteltests
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good beds and bathroom The breakfast was excelent and the service very good Close to a metro station was very comfortable Price ok

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel tucked at the outskirts of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chewbaca
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Hotel is a bit out of the way, but is a 1 min walk to a metro station on the outskirts of Paris. Staff was great. Room was a bit noisy. I was on first floor and water from floors above ( flushing, shower) would be a bit noisy at night and in the early morning. Place was clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Short beds”
Reviews.Author: Verliefd
Reviews.Content: The beds were only 1.80m long, my boyfriend is 1.86m long... so the bed was a little too short for us. We think we had quite a nice hotel in the centre of Paris, even though 95 euro's per night is quite expensive. We enjoyed our stay, had nice breakfasts and everything was well organized.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankieinLondon
Reviews.Content: Good location, 2 minutes walk from underground, 30 minutes travel from Gare du Nord. A bit downtown feeling in the area, but the hotel is absolutely clean, breakfast ok. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for 10 days”
Reviews.Author: QatarTom
Reviews.Content: On rest and relaxation from my current work assignment in the Middle East, the staff at the hotel contributed so much to the good time I had. It was my first time in Paris and I speak no French. The entire staff spoke very good English and helped me with sightseeing, restaurant and nightlife choices. For the money, I couldn't imagine staying at a better place. The metro stop is a one minute walk and makes any part of Paris you want to visit very accessible. Not hotel related, however I'd like to mention the French people were great hosts. Where all the lore of arrogant waitstaff and unfriendly people came from is beyond me. I've never been treated better anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Don't search longer.”
Reviews.Author: esser
Reviews.Content: I spent hours and hours reading the reviews on a lot of affordable hotels in Paris. Finally we selected this hotel because there were no negative comments in the reviews. We are an older couple and would be sure to have a quite, clean room. We asked for a room at the garden side of the building and could sleep even with open window. We stayed 3 nights, so four days long we explored Paris by metro which is at about 200 m. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but we can recommend the cosy 'L'Ingénu' Boulevard Voltaire 184, and the very, very small restaurant with the strange name 'Les Pissenlits par la Racine' in the Cité de Phalsbourg, both near to the hotel. And yes, the hotel has a parking. The driver's skill will be tried out when he is driving the car (if it is not too large) in the elevator and trying to put it between the white lines in the small underground parking. (By the way, I managed it with my Citroen Picasso. Thanks for your congratulations.) So leave your car there during your stay. We booked at www.hotelclub.net which offered us the best price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredric40
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and comfortable, with a more than adequate breakfast included. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and the reception staff spoke very good English (and would also accept my version of the French language without wincing). With a Metro station about 100 metres away it was easy to get to most parts of Paris, whilst some of the local attractions - Pere Lachaise Cemetery, Bastille, St. Martin Canal, - were within moderate walking distance. Several good restaurants and cafes nearby. As a solo traveller my twin room was spacious, but might be a little tight for two people, although the cost per person would then work out much cheaper. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed my 5 night stay (26-31 October) and would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: valbIllinois
Reviews.Content: small clean room with decent breakfast---staff couldn't have been nicer and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy, will probably stay there again”
Reviews.Author: theshoreman
Reviews.Content: If you're booking a hotel in Paris and looking for a good deal then I'd seriously consider this Hotel and its other loactions. This Hotel was a great price and you always take a risk when you bargain shop for foreign hotels. This hotel was very clean well lit, friendly staff, comfortable beds, great morning breakfast included, and located very close to a metro stop. We were able to get to any site in Paris within 10 minutes using the metro. If we are still on a budget the next time we go to Paris I will definitely book with a Classics Hotel. But I hope to afford more space and luxuries next time...don't we all.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel With Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jammer54
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 3 star establishment. The staff is outstanding - very professional and friendly and always willing to help in anyway. They speak fluent English and will gladly assist you with your plans and book you places to shows or dinners. Alverto, the night clerk is especially great. The location is great. There are many nearby restaraunts and stores and a metro station at the street corner. The neighberhood is more French and less touristy than other parts of Paris, which is nice. First time visitors to Paris should be aware that 3 star rooms are smallish and that breakfast may not be as rich as what they are used to at home.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in July”
Reviews.Author: hansgothenburg
Reviews.Content: Classics Hotel Bastille was a pleasant experience. Not a five star hotel but also not the price of a five star hotel. If you come to Paris for "tourism" it was excellent. Small, clean and with a very serviceminded staff. The location close to the Metro was just perfect. My wife and myself would definitely like to come back to this hotel next time we we would like to pay a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelingirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, and well located in the Bastille area. There isn't much in the Bastille area except some great little neighborhood restaurants, and plenty of take out delicious deli foods, fresh produce everywhere. The showers are tiny, but workable. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Plan to do a picnic in the back courtyard, they are very accommodating if you bring your own food in and enjoy the ambiance of the private yard.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, great location”
Reviews.Author: sexyc1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. The hotel is less than a minute's walk from both the Charonne metro stop and the 76 bus which takes you to the Louvre and also the main area of Bastille, although you could walk it to the centre of Bastille in about 20-25 mins. Breakfast is between 7am and 10am and there is an adequate selection of continental foods to choose from. We especially liked the fact that we had both hot and cold milk to choose from. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny. We enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it. However, we would probably try to find a hotel that's right in the centre of the nightlife of Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Small but confortable”
Reviews.Author: DaMa_7775
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me spent a 6 days holiday in Paris and we decided to book a room at the Hotel Bastille after reviewing many other hotels. Our goal was finding a comfortable, yet not too expansive, solution. I can now admit that the choice of Hotel Bastille was correct. The double room was clean, equipped with new furniture. To be sincere, the room was not very large but I think it is usual in Paris. I was also surprised by the cordiality of the staff, very polite and ready to take over your requests. Concerning the services, the breakfast is adequate for a 3 stars hotel and I personally found very interesting the possibility of accessing Internet with the hotel PC with a very cheap fare. The hotel is located not far from the Bastille square. Both the metro and the bus stop are very close to the hotel (only 50 metres). The hotel neighbourhood is rich of supermarkets and bakers, very useful if you want to prepare sandwiches for you journeys. Conversely, the area is more residential than tourist thus after 8pm it becomes a bit too quiet; if you want restaurants, shops, etc. you have to move to other district of Paris. To sum up, I warmly suggest this hotel to those not interested in luxury but in finding a valid base for their journeys in Paris. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Classics - All you need for a brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: lasouriante
Reviews.Content: Good location close to metro/bus and lots of local shops. Room very clean and lots of space for 2 adults and a child - we stayed in 3 bedded room. Staff really pleasant and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value for Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Harstan
Reviews.Content: Fair value, Clean, efficient breakfast, close to Metro, helpful staff, spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Amy_la_belge
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel in a great part of Paris (10 minute walk from Rue de Lappe and Place de la Bastille). Rooms were clean and nicely kept, although a little small. Hotel staff were pretty friendly and breakfast was very nice (continental breakfast - cereal, croissants, etc). I got a good deal by booking direct on the hotel website, getting 2 nights for €250, with 2 Paris museum passes for free which meant me and the other half could queue jump and get in free at most museums in Paris. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, nice staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dalmatia123
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel in a nice area. Very close to the metro stop "Charonne" (about a minute's walk). The rooms are nicely decorated, clean and modern. They are adequate in size. We asked for a room at the back of the hotel facing the courtyard so there was no traffic noise, although there was a very faint buzzing noise which might disturb any highly sensitive sleepers. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. There is an excellent patisserie shop a couple of shops down the road and also shops specialising in selling wine, cheese etc although we did not try those, but they looked nice shops. Some excellent offers if you book directly through their website. Our stay included a 2-day museum pass each worth 30euros each and we paid 230 euros in total for two people for two nights including breakfast. Breakfast was pretty good, cereal, croissants, fruit juice, bread, salami, yoghurt etc.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - decent hotel and room”
Reviews.Author: lemec2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of May 2008. Paid £99 a night through expedia over the bank holiday weekend. Certainly wasn't cheap but if you're looking for cheap then don't head to Paris! Hotel staff were friendly. We were on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel and the room was small with literally enough space for a double bed and a little wardrobe but more than adequate since we weren't there to sit in the hotel. Shower was fine as well, always hot and powerful. Breakfast was fine as well, standard continental fare which filled a gap in the morning. The room was also very quiet. Rue de Charonne isn't exactly amazingly beautiful but felt safe and was 30 seconds from Charonne metro and about 8 mins walk from Alexandre Dumas which you can get to on the metro 2 line from Gare du Nord/Chapelle if you're coming on the Eurostar. We spent two days at Disney as well and was about 10 mins walk from Nation where trains departed to the park. Recommend the bisto Malac round the corner for somewhere really French to eat. The little place next door wasn't bad either if you just want some basic cheap food and you're too lazy to walk anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Better Hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SamandGus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the Reviews here but were disappointed. I have visited Paris several times in the last ten years and know there are better alternatives. There was nothing wrong with the Hotel as such but would i recommend it to a friend - No, would i book it again - No. We had a delux room which i think differed from the standard rooms in that it was at the back of the hotel so wasn't overlooking the street, also we had tea making facilities although there was no coffee, no milk and only three teabags [one of which was earl grey tea] and noticed for one morning the maid had not replaced them so there was no tea that day. I wanted a hotel in Bastille because i love the area [fab for restautants/bars/cafes etc] but this hotel is definitely situated in the shabbier part of Bastille. The front of the Hotel is also shabbier than the pictures you can view online. We did not have the breakfast, preferring to grab a pain au chocolat and coffee en route so cannot comment on that but viewing it in the morning as we left there didn't seem anything terribly special about it. The bathroom had recently been renovated i think but had no bath, also there were no towel rails so you were forced to have them replaced on a daily basis. As from previous reviews here the staff were polite but unenthusiastic, also there were daily papers, sometimes out of date, but who wants to read an english paper whilst on holiday in a foreign country, so would not consider this a selling point? The room was very clean which does count for a lot, but the beds, whilst comfortable had rubber undersheets which seemed insulting and didn't aid a restful nights sleep. Overall Paris was as fantastic as always, a real find is a restaurant just around the corner on Cite de Phalsbourg called les pissenlits par la racine; it is a real local restaurant [wine came out of a box in a cupboard and the music was provided by an iPod plugged into speakers], the bowls of salad are a MUST [and thats from someone who doesn't usually eat rabbit food!] and the waiter is brilliant - he stood and did Goat impressions in the middle of the place when we asked what Chevre was, who says french waiters are bad tempered?! My advice, book another hotel! PS. if anyone knows what happened to Jim Morrison's grave pease put it in a Review!

HotelInfo.Name: Classics Hotel Bastille
HotelInfo.Address: 131, rue de Charonne | 11th Arr., 75011 Paris, France
